website_summaries.verdict: A stylish little number that's simple to operate with smart automated signal selection.
pros: Allows up to three HDMI products to be routed to one display
It's very easy to install and operate — just plug in and play
Can be programmed to other all-in-one remote controls
cons: Apple TV's "always active" state might cause problems with auto switch, but the manual override can be used

customer_reviews.title: flawless
customer_reviews.text: Using for my PC and PS4, works absolutely perfect without lose in video quality.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Bohart

customer_reviews.title: Works great, and just keeps working
customer_reviews.text: My only gripe (which honestly isn't even a gripe) is that Kinivo kept the model number and appearance over the past 10 years, despite adding a few nice new features (allowing one to disable automatic switching, for instance) on the current version. As a result, I was going crazy trying to figure out why my 10-year-old version of the 501BN didn't do what the docs for this one said it would. Turns out, it's just old (it still works every bit as well as it ever did, but it just can't do everything this one does). Both the old one AND this one are still great switches, though.
customer_reviews.author: VeryVito

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: This did not work for me. I tried it with Amazon's Fire TV and a Sony Blu-Ray player and the Fire did not work at all and the Blu-Ray didn't pass through sound. I contacted the company and they responded quickly and tried to help, but either I confused them or they me and the emails got off into technical audio/video/receiver configurations that had nothing to do with my problem. I bought an inexpensive mechanical bi-directional switch and it worked perfectly. I chalk this up to a $40.00 learning experience.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Absolute garbage, no idea how it got so many good ...
customer_reviews.text: Signal bugs out so often that it's impossible to use this. Using brand new cables for all connections and when playing PS4 on it, the signal handshake gets all garbled and it cuts out or you have to try and play with red scan lines going across the screen 100% of the time. Will be returning this post haste and avoiding this manufacturer entirely. Absolute garbage, no idea how it got so many good reviews when it's literally hot dumpster juice.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Conley

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as expected and more
customer_reviews.text: This device is a god send when more and more devices are being manufactured with less and less I/O ports. I currently use this to hook up multiple gaming systems to a large screen tv and so far it works wonderfully for all them. No screen lag or anything outside normal latency for HDMI. Also I discovered that despite this coming with a controller that there is no need for it in most instances. The box will automatically switch to the live system if you fully shutdown or sleep each system so as you turn off one and turn the other on you do not have to bother manually switching it.
customer_reviews.author: Bob the budget tech geek

customer_reviews.title: Smart switching not smart enough for some consoles, manual switch is great
customer_reviews.text: We've been using this for a while. We tried leaving it on the default smart switch mode, but the PS4 waking up to would cause the Kinivo to swap off the Nintendo Switch game I was playing. So we set it to manual swap mode and have been fairly happy since then.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney E. Christensen

customer_reviews.title: Device started jumping to each hdmi input automatically
customer_reviews.text: This device worked well for about 3 days, then I turned it on and notice that TV was up then would go on and off again. Looking at the device, it was going from one port to the other without anyone touching it. I removed batteries from the remote thinking it was sending signals in appropriately but that wasn't it either! ... JUNK! ... isn't worth my time to return and go through all the BS... won't buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Daxx

customer_reviews.title: Works, but has a flaw
customer_reviews.text: Mostly this works as advertised, but the automatic switching does not make me happy. I want to switch between a ROKU and a computer connection. The ROKU is always on, the computer is only on when in use for streaming to the TV. I hoped the switch would go to the ROKU when we switch off the computer, but it doesn't. We can live with that. But worse, when we watch using the ROKU, the switch switches to the other connection (the turned off computer) in the middle of movies at unexpected times for no reason we can discern. We then have to use the remote to switch it back from a black screen to whatever we were watching.
customer_reviews.author: Digita

customer_reviews.title: The quality of this splitter is amazing, way better than others I've tried
customer_reviews.text: The quality of this splitter is amazing, way better than others I've tried. I primarily got this because I heard it was worked with PS3. The splitter I had before did not work well. Everything I use with this spitter has amazing picture quality and it's easy to switch things around. The only thing I dislike are the bright lights on the front. They're like beacons of death when you're trying to sleep, so I have to keep it unplugged when it's not actively being used. Other then that, works great!
customer_reviews.author: Arei

customer_reviews.title: *Caution*
customer_reviews.text: Was I perfectly fine with switching out older HDMI products that rarely got used? Yes Did my girlfriend absolutely want to plug this into the receiver to give us more HDMI ports? Yes Did this fry the $300 receiver and put me back in the market to buy a new receiver that cost $800? Yes Learn from my mistakes, don't let anyone's laziness destroy the electronics. On a side note, we had used this consistently and perfectly on a separate TV prior to coming up with the excellent idea of plugging it into a home audio receiver for more ports.
customer_reviews.author: KTGiang

customer_reviews.title: The unit looks nice and works good but I have some issues with ...
customer_reviews.text: The unit looks nice and works good but I have some issues with it. The red and blue LEDs are very bright. On the TV stand, especially at night, the bright LEDs take your eyes from the TV, I ended up putting black tape over them. Next, the remote is on the same frequency or sends the same data that the unit changes my streamer device and vise versa. I use my streamer and the unit keeps switching channels, I switch channels and the streamer turns on or off. so very annoying. I emailed the company about this and they haven not responded. I will probably be returning the unit and going with a different manufacture.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Kratt

customer_reviews.title: It works ..for now. I am optimistic.
customer_reviews.text: The remote did not work immediately. I complained to the seller who replaced the remote within a few days. Bravo to the seller! I tried to replace the battery in the remote but could not open the battery compartment. All the messing around must have dislodged something because the remote began to work. Despite the instructions, it turns out that the screw on the remote must be removed to access the battery in the compartment which is a fact that is not in the directions. Conclusion: I gave this product 3 stars because the device works, the remote mostly works, and customer support is responsive but the directions are inadequate.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Grossman

customer_reviews.title: Very Robust and Reliable
customer_reviews.text: I have (actually 9) laptops stacked on top of each other. They all connect to the same Monitor, Keyboard and Mouse. The Monitor connection is via HDMI and This is the switch that I use for 5 of them. I've had several of these 5 HDMI switches. NONE has been as well made and durable as the Kinivo 501BN. It was, as I recall, a little more than some of the others--maybe $10. Certainly worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Paul J Brown

customer_reviews.title: Reliable products and service!
customer_reviews.text: Kinivo is a great company that is not satisfied with the sale until the customer is. I had a strange issue getting my configuration working, and Kinivo support stuck with me for a week of troubleshooting until they discovered a solution. There are so many companies that hawk cheap electronic products and only make minor attempts to support post-sale. Kinivo is not one of those companies. I so appreciate the work they did with me to get my setup working, and will absolutely be a repeat customer of theirs. Kinivo has exceeded my expections and I highly recommend their products and support!
customer_reviews.author: g2netshopper

customer_reviews.title: It works fine without the switch so I returned it
customer_reviews.text: The product failed to work with my set up. I have two HDMI extenders to cat6 cables hooked up to my Samsung TV. Every time there was a pause with the cable service, such as loading an on-demand movie, it would think that nothing was being transmitted, and turn off. I've read that there is sometimes there is an issue with the high definition content protection and this could be the case. But I was not willing to figure it out and the product did not work as expected. It also would not automatically switch between my Xbox and my DVR. It works fine without the switch so I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: kruzmissile17

customer_reviews.title: Get the new Kinivo K540 Switch
customer_reviews.text: The new Kinivo K540 has the ability to turn off the box and it's annoying blue lights. to quote their tech support: The 301BN and 501BN HDMI switches do not have the ability to dim the LEDs, nor can they be powered off via the remote control. The only way to power off the 301BN or 501BN switches is to unplug them from the power outlet. We do have two new switches, the K340 and K540. They both support 4K, have dimmer LEDs and they can be powered off via the included remote control or an activity on a Logitech Harmony.
customer_reviews.author: Bob in Chesapeake

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and simple to use HDMI switch!
customer_reviews.text: This switch has worked perfectly for my application. I've hooked up two inputs to the switch; a Roku stick and a blu-ray output. You only have to press in the remote the specific input you want to switch and vuala!. Also, you can use the memory button to set the default input. The only thing I would like to suggest is to dim the indicator lights, they are to bright for a movie room. I used a sharpie black marker to cover the bright indicator leds. Good product!
customer_reviews.author: Marco Ahumada

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted for my TV at a good price!
customer_reviews.text: I've got an older 50'' plasma in the basement I setup for the kids with Xbox One S, Nintendo Switch, an Apple TV, Xbox 360 and Nintendo Wii. This was a perfect solution for my older TV. The remote works well. Sometimes there is a slight delay when I select my setting and when the picture shows but we're talking a second or so and then its fine it's just the first time I flip it. Also the HDMI out is touchy so you really don't want to bump it or anything but overall this is great.
customer_reviews.author: Alex K.

customer_reviews.title: Easy Device; 4-years and running.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased about four years ago, and works flawlessly. Have a PS4, Apple TV, Blu Ray player, XBOX, etc... all connected, and I’ve experience no trouble with the switch or remote. I do recommend you turn on the device you intend to use, THEN click over to that device. Ex. I power on my APPLE TV, then flip my tuner to the HDMI port of the switch. The HDMI switch will auto to that device. IF it doesn’t, use the remote. Really easy.
customer_reviews.author: Mail Debaser

customer_reviews.title: Great HDMI Switch!  MUCH better than others I've tried!
customer_reviews.text: This Kinivo 501BN 5-Port HDMI switch works exactly like it's supposed to. I've had mine for a while now, and have had no issues at all. That's something I can't say for some other HDMI switches I've tried. Mine is hooked up to a PS4, a Nintendo Switch, a Roku 3 box, a DirecTV box, and a Sony Blu-ray player. It has performed flawlessly, and I'm very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: ssorge1

customer_reviews.title: Didnt work so I sent it back
customer_reviews.text: Got it and followed all the instructions for set up. IT DIDNT WORK. It wouldn't switch or even transmit from the outputs. Tried multiple HDMI cables and different input sources. Figured out it was the box itself that was not working. Return was easy through Amazon but you couldnt just exchange for another device. You have to return the device and then reorder another one. Maybe I just got a bad unit but I order a different brand and that one worked great.
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: Power drops
customer_reviews.text: I have the 3-port version of this product and it works perfectly for my cable box, Raspberry Pi, and PS4. However, in the winter time when the heat kicks on in my home and my PS4 is on, it makes the power drop constantly. There is no problem in the summer with the air conditioning. There is also no problem with the Raspberry Pi or the cable box. But the PS4 and the heat kicking on simultaneously make the power spike constantly and causes it to constantly flicker on my TV. This is very annoying. I even have the switch plugged into a UPS and that does not help.
customer_reviews.author: iLLWiLL

customer_reviews.title: ... has worked well for over two years but went bad awhile back
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace a different brand switch which has worked well for over two years but went bad awhile back. This one looks identical to the old one??? Installed it and could not get a clear signal and any of the inputs, swapped out HDMI cable for know good ones without any success. Signal for go in and out, lots of snow in the picture, etc... Moving on to something else, after 2+ hours.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Tetlow

customer_reviews.title: This is an awesome product
customer_reviews.text: We have an assortment of peripherals with all our grandsons switch and PS4, then there is the dvd player and the TV service console, things were constantly either changing inputs or actual HDMI cables switching. We loved this so much we bought two, another for our daughters TV. Now his games change their input on their own, no more jumbled cables to find the right one to switch out. Fantastic product if you have a lot of devices or even just a few.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I've been using it for 2 months now. It ...
customer_reviews.text: I've been using it for 2 months now. It works well most of the time. Sometimes there seems to be a delay in getting the feed to the TV. My set up is 3 inputs (DirecTV, Xbox, and Blue Ray), and the output goes to a Sound Bar system and from Sound Bar to TV for video. I don't know if the set up is causing the delay; however, I had a previous HDMI switch that didn't have such an issue. I only replaced it because it stopped working after I moved for whatever reason.
customer_reviews.author: M. Nehme

customer_reviews.title: This was also the best priced HDMI switch I found on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: I cannot say if it runs higher resolutions or frame rates, but it works well for my home office. I have one large monitor at home, with a mac mini via HDMI. For work I use a Windows laptop. I can run both computers and switch main monitor between laptop and mac without issue. Works well for online meetings, when I'm not presenting I can be surfing on my personal mac with the main monitor and conferencing just on the laptop. When I need to present, I switch main monitor back to laptop and run as a second display. This was also the best priced HDMI switch I found on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: JLB85

customer_reviews.title: Did exactly what we need it to
customer_reviews.text: It is very nice to have a way to quickly switch between a DVD player, cable stream, Chromecast, and laptop HDMI input using such a compact device. We haven't noticed any decrease in quality, and the automatic switching when it detects a new input has been nice, esp. when using a laptop.
customer_reviews.author: turtlemonvh

customer_reviews.title: Great Experience with Kinivo HDMI Switch
customer_reviews.text: The switch worked well right out of the box! Extremely smart setup; my first HDMI switch box but virtually a no-brainer! The remote is small with battery included. I own both Roku and Fire TV devices. Used the switch to toggle between the two. Some may question the rationale for using both streaming devices as they perform the same functions but the Fire TV was my first streaming device purchase. Bought Roku 2 (three of them!) later and much prefer them but needed to keep all devices updated and functional. FYI: FandangoNow is a favorite app of mine not offered on Amazon Fire TV or Fire Stick! Happy so far!
customer_reviews.author: Judith Lonesome-Sanders

customer_reviews.title: No audio...warrnatny replacement is working perfectly! 8/2/2017
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup easy to use. Will not carry audio signal no matter what cables or devices are connected to it. Very disappointed 1/5 stars update 8/2/2017... I contacted the company Directly, They honored the warranty, sent em a return label and a new switch. Currently the new switch has a samsung blu ray in 1 a Raspberry pi in 2 and one in 3 as well as an Xbox one in 4...they all are working flawlessly and audio is incredible. Thank you for correcting the problem 5/5 stars
customer_reviews.author: typeo

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I ordered this HDMI switch because we were tired of changing out the devices that were plugged into the tv. This has definitely solved our problem. It is very easy to use. You can switch between HDMI devices from the actual box or the included remote. The box is about the size of an Apple TV or Amazon Fire TV, so it isn't too obtrusive, but it is noticeable sitting on our TV stand. We have been using this for about six month and we haven't had any technical issues and the quality has been great. I would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Died after 3 months.
customer_reviews.text: Died on me after 3 months. When it did work it would barely work with my Nintendo Switch. This is mostly the Switches fault as I've heard it sends an HDMI pulse every 5 minutes which is stupid, but if this HDMI switch had an option at all to disable auto switching it would have been fine. Now though, no output at all from this thing, TV doesn't even recognize an HDMI input.
customer_reviews.author: Jonah

customer_reviews.title: Where did sound go?
customer_reviews.text: Worked right out of box. Automatically switches from cable box/TV to DVD player/TV. Indicator lights tell you which of the five inputs are active to TV. Ocasionaly won't have any sound when turning on cable system in the morning. I get it,back by switching Knivio to different input and back. Don't know why it does that but the first time I did not have sound I was checking TV settings, cable box settings to no avail. When I switched inputs and back, sound came back. It has done this only 2 or 3 times in,the last 2 months. No big deal since I figured out how to get sound back. If someone knows a better fix let me know.
customer_reviews.author: B. L. Huffman

customer_reviews.title: Works when others failed
customer_reviews.text: To run our Xbox, Cable, and Roku into the TV - we needed a hdmi separator. Bought a Rocketfish at Best Buy - failed - blank screen. Bought a different one at Walmart - Onn brand - failed. Bought the Kinivo and it works great. Sound, picture, ease of install and use - all great. Such a frustrating day - but success in the end.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew R. Foster

customer_reviews.title: Best HDMI Switch on the Market
customer_reviews.text: Bought this auto-switcher because one of the TV's I have is still very nice, but only has one HDMI port and I needed more than one, but didn't want to have to manually switch between devices. At first I thought I made a mistake, because one of my devices is an Amazon Fire Stick, which really doesn't power off/on like my blu-ray player does, so the switcher never auto-sensed it. But then I had a thought to try and add the switch to the Harmony Remote that I already had, and sure enough it is an available device, so the remote and hub do the switching for everything now. AWESOME!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect 3 for 1 HDMI Switch
customer_reviews.text: This is an impressive high performing product, extremely simple to hook up and install 3 devices with HDMI to my television set which only has 1 HDMI input. Connecting the TV HDMI cable to this device Output, then using 3 HDMI cables connecting to the device Inputs 1, 2, and 3 connected the Cable box, Blu-Ray player, and PS-3. Each product plays back with perfect quality and performance, and to top everything off the device will automatically switch to the next device once you turn on to use. Extremely user friendly, high performing, and is barely the size of a cigarette box. Anyone not wanting to buy a new television just for more HDMI ports, this is a must buy.
customer_reviews.author: JB1960

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: I needed a reliable switch have many things to go between, remote sucks, have to be standing in front of box, even then works sometimes (yes have changed the batteries), then it gets confused when you fire up multiple items such as the switch at the same time as the PS4, not good. Sometimes it cannot find the plugged in HDMI cables. Buyer beware, I still have not found a good alternative, if someone has one please let me know, thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Jason M.

customer_reviews.title: Works, but is poorly designed mechanically
customer_reviews.text: This device does what it is supposed to do electronically, but suffers from very poor design of connectors. It constantly loses connectivity with the cables. One has to push the cable all the way in (and then some) to make it connect. Any disturbance/motion of the cable afterwards will make it lose connectivity with this device. Once one's connected the cables and made them work, one can't move this device even one millimeter, since it will make it lose connectivity. This is very annoying and strange. HDMI connectors don't normally suffer from such issues. These ones do.
customer_reviews.author: AndreyT

customer_reviews.title: Works great, auto-switching works well.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Auto-switch works fine. I have been using the 3-port version for a few years now with satisfaction. Now I needed a second one with more ports and am happy to purchase this 5-port version. I usually try to plug my always-on devices directly to the TV (media streaming devices like the Fire Stick or Apple TV) just to avoid confusion with the auto-switching, however, that still works well with these. Just put your hard on/off devices (like game consoles) on higher number ports and it will prioritize those when powered on, and when you power off that device it switches back to the always-on device.
customer_reviews.author: Mark H.

customer_reviews.title: Finally, a HDMI switcher that WORKS!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a powered HDMI switcher for my PS4, PS3, and mini-Nintendo system. The first one I bought from a store locally and it did not work properly, even when powered, it wouldn't switch and only turned on half the time. After reading reviews I decided to try this one out, and it works terrific. Some say the lights are too distracting, but I don't find that to be the case, I suppose it's where you decide to house it? Anyways, it does everything it's supposed to do, and it's not pricey. I've had it for about 4 months now, no issues whatsoever. Highly reccomended.
customer_reviews.author: D. Fitch

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: This device works perfectly. The automatic switching means I seldom need the remote. I give it 5 stars but there is one minor annoying factor. The lights on the front panel are very bright and distracting. The device must face the user because the remote sensor requires line of sight to operate correctly. Currently I am using a piece of cardboard to cover the lights, leaving the remote sensor exposed for use if needed. As I said, it is a minor annoyance.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Remote Didn't Work when box was received
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to replace a less expensive box that stopped working 2 months after purchase. Hopefully based on the reviews this one won't have that issue. I will update my review if it stops working. So far the remote does not work, I might have to replace the battery which shouldn't be dead since I just received the box. Other than that it works to switch between my cable box, PS4, and laptop. There is a black flicker every now and again like it's switching over (when we haven't touched anything) and the TV says HDMI 1, but it doesn't interrupt anything and it's very infrequent.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Great product & great customer service
customer_reviews.text: I read alot of helpful reviews for this HDMI switcher before purchasing. It was easy to setup and it just works. About 3 months in, the blue lights no longer lit and the unit was dead. I reached out to Kinivo and they had a new unit shipped right out - extremely great customer service. Everything is back up and running again. I highly recommend this switcher because Kinivo stand behind their 1yr warranty.
customer_reviews.author: TF

customer_reviews.title: Connect and forget.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great hub for connecting multiple devices to the TV. I’m using this hub to connect a DVD player and the cable box to the TV and it works perfectly. Be aware that you must point the remote at the switch box in order for it to do its job. Great solution for TVs that only have 1 HDMI connection. I’m very satisfied and would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: J siegel

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after a year
customer_reviews.text: First, let me say that the switch worked well when first purchased in May of 2017. It did what it was supposed to do which is switch from one HDMI device to another. Unfortunately, a little over a year later it started switching from Direct TV to my Roku when I'm watching TV and won't allow me to switch back unless I unplug the unit and try again. I thought maybe I had a bad cable so I got new ones. I even tried switching the ports around with no luck. I really liked the switch and I'm debating whether or not to purchase again. It was a good product, just keep in mind it may not last.
customer_reviews.author: JCalla

customer_reviews.title: Awesome performance--for 24 hours
customer_reviews.text: Awesome performance--for 24 hours. However, HDCP issues arose one-by-one with all my devices. One device--an older Sony DVD juke box--wouldn't even send a blue screen: no output at all. HDCP is notorious, and Sony even more so, on DRM issues, so I can't be certain the switch is the source of my problems--except that the advertising assures that it's compatible with all devices, when it's clearly not. I'm still researching, trying to find a compatible 5 port switch.
customer_reviews.author: Max G.

customer_reviews.title: worked for a month or two, no star is correct
customer_reviews.text: I was blaming other factors as to how the HDMI box was working, is it my TV or Blu-ray, etc. I didn't use it as much and went to New Zealand for three weeks during the time I purchased until 1st of May. The picture would change over but there was an issue with the sound and once I finally spent sometime running separate HDMI leads to my devices. Well it is obvious this thing doesn't work like it did in the beginning month or two. I would like a refund but I am sure that is a joke...
customer_reviews.author: FIREGURU

customer_reviews.title: Decent product but after about 3 yrs it started to ...
customer_reviews.text: Decent product but after about 3 yrs it started to cut out - screen on the TV would cut out for a second or two. Would sometimes happen repeatedly every 30 seconds, sometimes it wouldn't happen at all. After moving components around and trying new HDMI cables I finally bought a new switch (different brand, 4K@60HZ) and the problem was corrected. Still 4 stars because it worked for more than 3 years without problems and was worth the money I spent.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Moore

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this product!!
customer_reviews.text: I used this device for almost 6 months right now and from the beginning every thing works great but there's a serious problem shown up before 2 months. That problem is about changing the channel between HDMI without any order or command by me. For example I put many HDMI channels in this device one of them is for Playstation 4 and while I'm playing the device suddenly changed the HDMI channel to TV??? And I faced that problem many times unfortunately it's just being a habit for the device.. And now I'm going to buy another device to do this job.. I didn't recommend to buy this device
customer_reviews.author: Fadi F. R.

customer_reviews.title: Works well!
customer_reviews.text: Been using this for a while now and it works pretty well, although the auto-switching can be finicky from time to time. When using anything with limited inputs, soundbar for me, this fits the bill and doesn't break the bank. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: No problems at all
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly right out of the box. Plugged in Roku3, AppleTV, and XBox 360. Didn't try auto-switching, but setup was painless and worked straight off with my Harmony remote. Video quality is preserved for each device and switching is completely controlled through the Harmony. I would be slightly happier if the bright blue lights could be shut off. They are a bit distracting while watching content in a dark room.
customer_reviews.author: mazzas

customer_reviews.title: GREAT Customer Support
customer_reviews.text: When I got it I plugged everything in, it didn't work. So I contacted their support and the next day, I got a response and we started to troubleshoot it until there was nothing else to try. When we got to that they sent me a replacement unit and I have yet to have a problem with it.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Easy plug and play
customer_reviews.text: This particular unit is a great option if you have more devices than available HDMI inputs on your TV. I've been using it for a couple weeks now and it has worked without a hitch so far. There is no degradation in picture quality while multiple, powered-on devices are hooked up to it. No more yanking the cord from the back of the Apple TV, plugging it into the Fire Stick or Xbox and vice versa. It also comes with a remote control, which is mentioned in the description but not shown in the product pictures.
customer_reviews.author: NJB

customer_reviews.title: There has to be something better...
customer_reviews.text: Trying to use this with a Chromecast, Switch, and Roku is not fun at all. Not sure if the device interferes with the other wireless devices, but the others don't see to function normally since I got this HDMI switch. The remote barely works, the HDMI switch struggles to change between devices, and overall it just seems to be lacking. Which is a lot to say for something pretty simple. I've gone back to just flipping cables when needed since my return window passed already.
customer_reviews.author: Flayre

customer_reviews.title: Worked for about Three Weeks
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband and there were a few problems, such as taking a bit longer to switch over and issues with the remote. I kept it to use myself at a later time. I unpacked it, it was only used for about a week before being put back into the box when it was originally bought, and for the first week, it worked! Switching was easy and it responded well. Today I went to use it and while the power comes on the system no longer switches. I changed up the inputs; unplugged and replugged, but nothing worked. Not reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Western28

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy build, autoswitch works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great! A little more expensive than other switchers I’ve used but those haven’t lasted long so I spent a bit more - the build quality is nice, feels like a hefty device but not overly so. Autoswitching works just as I hoped it would. I use this with a FireTV Cube (always on), a Nintendo Switch and a Samsung 4K Blu-ray player. It handles the full 4K of the Samsung and UHD of Amazon and HDR of Netflix just fine. It defaults to the always on device normally but auto switches to the others when powered on (and back, when powered off). Only 4 stars because I’ve not used the remote or manual switching.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Woodard

customer_reviews.title: Excellent support
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I originally got a defective unit, but contacted support. They were very courteous. Did some basic troubleshooting to try to resolve things quickly, and was very willing to replace with a new unit when it became clear that would be the fastest and easiest way to resolve the issue. (Note: It wants "newer" HDMI cables, especially for the output port. I had been using some 1st-gen HDMI cables, which it didn't recognize.)
customer_reviews.author: Jim Moore

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: I loved how easy to set up this is. I added my cable box, Roku and Fire Stick. I use the included remote to change the input and each item stays loaded and ready to go. No more waiting. This device saved me from having to purchase a larger TV with more HDMI ports which would not have allowed each input to be already loaded. Now to figure out how to hide all of the power cords and hdmi cables. This is a great product and an excellent purchase! Will be coming back for the 5 port, when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's complicated, very complicated
customer_reviews.text: As highly rated as this expensive HDMI switch is, i was surprised it didn't work with Amazon's Fire TV Stick and one other component (a digital video recorder - DVR). This switch cancelled out the TV's audio altogether and wouldn't work with the DVR. I ended up replacing this switch with a simplified HDMI switch splitter (approx. $10 on Amazon) which did the trick - so long as the DVR is off when using the Fire TV Stick. Long story short, you are much better off buying an HD TV with 4 HDMI inputs (rather than just 2) and not having to deal with HDMI switches, which can be a real headache depending on the specific components you are using.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Kagan

customer_reviews.title: Works great to connect multiple devices to a limited number of HDMI inputs.
customer_reviews.text: We picked this switcher up to be able to use my son’s multiple gaming systems with a tv that only has 2 HDMI ports. It works really well! Unfortunately the dog ate the tiny remote an the 3rd day we had it! But it’s fine, because when you Power a system up, this box switches to it automatically, it’s very handy. I would certainly buy another if I ever have the need.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J.

customer_reviews.title: May have to return. It's starting to not automatically ...
customer_reviews.text: May have to return. It's starting to not automatically tune to the active connection. I have to use the remote. I think a few other people had the same issue. That was a plus for me, not having to use the remote. Just have the one device on that it will show..but it's not even doing that now. Update: customer service is awesome, replaced. But again, does not change automatically. If you don't mind using the remote, than you're good. But I'm going to say, you have a wry good chance of it going bad in a few months. Very good change.
customer_reviews.author: sarcino

customer_reviews.title: Works great for my cord cutting, dual source solution.
customer_reviews.text: So far, this has worked like a charm. I use this in my office with an older small HD TV that only has one HDMI port.....this switch helps me with my cord cutting solution, it switches between the FireTV unit where I subscribe to Playstation VUE, for all my "cable channels" I like (CNN, Fox News, MSNBC, ESPN1-3, FX, etc).....and my Tivo mini hooked into the main Tivo Roamio OTA for all local channels over the antenna in my living room. This little switch breathed new life into an old TV so it can work with my new dual source cord cutting solution.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I have my Playstation, Ruko, and DVD player plugged into this. I have no issues with video or disconnecting. I don't need to use the remote that came with it as my TV has the options for me to change from one source to another with the TV remote and it works well. I have had it for approximately 6 months and it works well. It was a great price and not that big. I love that it has 4 inputs. It has soft blue lights on it for each input that is active.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Second one works great
customer_reviews.text: So far, this unit has worked perfectly. The first one I ordered did not recognize the inputs but Amazon made it easy to return for a replacement. The replacement unit is so far working flawlessly. It's very easy to switch between an extra monitor for the PC and the Xbox. Would highly recommend for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Solid device, but packaging fumble..
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected. Plugged it right into my Samsung TV (Model UN39FH5000F) with the following devices: * Amazon Fire TV * Google Chromecast Stick * Samsumg Blu-Ray/DVD Player (Model BD-H5100) Works like a charm. Video quality is excellent. I highly recommend it. The only knock I have is about the packaging. Inside the box, there was a couple of dried blood smear marks (nothing huge, but it was noticeable). It almost seemed as if someone was packaging the device, and they had a paper cut. There wasn't any blood marks on the device itself - just on the box. I would have given a ranking of 5 stars if it wasn't for that packaging mishap.
customer_reviews.author: Harold L. Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Started good, but had ended bad...
customer_reviews.text: I have had this product for over a year. Initially, it worked fine, however, over the months the box increasingly automatically switched, seamlessly to whatever device. PS4, Fire, Chromecast.... While I was using the Fire, it automatically switched over to Chromecast. I started to believe it was the cables, however after changing them, it still did not resolve the issue. Now, I am experiencing Input issues. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Chatonia

customer_reviews.title: I just kept staring at the screen almost shocked how good it looked as I watched Clemson dismantle Oklahoma in ...
customer_reviews.text: So far, it works flawlessly and exactly as hoped for. In fact, I honestly noticed a marked improvement in my display quality (after replacing an older splitter). I just kept staring at the screen almost shocked how good it looked as I watched Clemson dismantle Oklahoma in the playoff today. My wife kept getting annoyed as I said, over and over, hey, take a look at the screen - does it look a whole lot better to you? Now I merely wait and see if the product will hold up well over time. I suppose my only suggested improvement would be a dimmer for the lights... which are a little bright.
customer_reviews.author: Adelino L.

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing!
customer_reviews.text: This little thing has come in quite handy. Most TV's have about 3 HDMI ports which may seem like a lot but this day in age is not many. If you are like myself who has a PS4, Firestick, Apple TV, Blue Ray player, along with the cable box you under stand that 3 HDMI ports just don't cut it. Then I found this device for a one time charge of $40... it has 5 HDMI ports and comes with its own special remote to change the imput on each device...genious! No more pulling wires to switch from blue ray to apple tv and so forth....this machine fixed that issue for me.... Bravo to whoever created this.
customer_reviews.author: Jason L

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!!!
customer_reviews.text: I received this switch yesterday and got it hooked up and running. My Sony TV only has two HDMI jacks and I have three devises to connect to it and this Kinivo 3 port high speed HDMI switch, with remote, makes it possible. I have a Cisco RNG150 set-top-box, a Sony Blu-Ray DVD player and my PC connected to this switch. It's small...all the ports are in back so you don't see the cables...the power supply comes out the side with a right angle plug and makes it very clean looking. It's really cool! And you can't beat the price! I would have given 5 stars but I've only had it one day. I hope it lasts a long time!
customer_reviews.author: William S. Faulkner

customer_reviews.title: Bottom line...it works like it advertises!  It's truly a wonderful piece of technology.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for a few weeks now, and I have not had any issues! Sad that I must start a review that way, but it's true. I have gone through many cheaper switches, this one is awesome! It truly works as advertised and provides clean switching....something that other switches lack. I appreciate the fact that there is no freezing or stability issues. I have experienced nothing but rock solid build quality and seamless switching each and every time I use this! Thanks for a wonderful product that holds up to the test of many items plugged in at once! The autoswitch feature is also appreciated, and easily bypassed with the remote if you need to.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew A. Bates

customer_reviews.title: meh
customer_reviews.text: While it switches fine, it suffers from bad insulation. The power to this device comes across as static. If you are using this as a visual component only and have an audio receiver for your audio that is separate from this, then this will work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew P.

customer_reviews.title: almost like its overheating but its not
customer_reviews.text: This thing started having issues only a few weeks after purchase. It constantly has to be restarted in order to output the correct resolution, almost like its overheating but its not. Its quite annoying. Beyond that, the remote has to be very direct to it, even with a fresh battery. Not a whole lot of leeway. Unfortunately it breaks just after the return window closes, so I'm stuck spending money on yet another product. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Geoffrey Bricker

customer_reviews.title: I am pretty impressed
customer_reviews.text: It is a powerful little thing. I expected it to be much larger but it works great. No noticeable picture degradation whatsoever. I run all my hdmi video game systems through it. Very easy to switch back and forth. The fact that it will turn on the TV (if you have hdmi control on your tv) and switch to the correct input when I hit the power button on a system always impresses me. Definitely the best bang for the buck when it comes to HDMI switchers. I velcroed it to the back of my TV. It is so light and small, the whole operation easily tucks away and works flawlessley with very little need for the remote.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: I have my computer, PS4, and xbox one all connected to my widescreen monitor which originally only had one HDMI slot. This switch works like a charm and I love it's auto detecting feature, as it switches automatically to whateve you turn on. Then remote that comes with this is also slim and great for switching from one HDMI port to another very fast. I will be purchasing more in the future for more rooms in my house.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Smile

customer_reviews.title: WORKS Perfect- better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Our older TV has only two USB ports and we needed 3. This solved all my problems easily and quickly. You will need an extra usb cable so plan ahead. It is SO easy to switch back and forth...it sure beats manually disconnecting and connecting wires!
customer_reviews.author: BURT

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing. Very happy, great product for the price. In my living room, I have a 50" LED TV with only 2 HDMI ports and I have a Blu-Ray Player, Cable, XBox, Amazon Prime firestick, so I needed to have a box to hook them all into TV. This product worked perfect, ran all the HDMI's into it. Its always hooked up. Has the little remote to just change to the input I want. Has bright LED lights on it in the front. Probably not the fastest selector but I also think my TV is a little slow getting the input. I totally recommend for that home entertainment system. Thanks Kinivo!
customer_reviews.author: Dan Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Just what we needed
customer_reviews.text: Our TV only has a couple HDMI inputs and we needed more. I loved being able to hook all of the devices into this hub. When the devices are off it doesn't even recognize them, but as soon as you turn it on it switches to that automatically. The remote is a nice feature that I thought would come in handy, but so far with the automatic changing by turning devices on and off, we haven't had to really use it.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer L. Sisson

customer_reviews.title: Great Switch!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace my previous smart HDMI switch, and couldn't be happier. I have a Xfinity cable box that stays on all the time unless you physically press the power button on the box. With my OLD SWITCH, the smart feature would switch over to the cable box while I played my PS4 because the cable box was still running. With this box I have never had that problem in the 4+ months I've used it. The cable box stays on and even though I'm on the PS4 it does not switch back.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: I have four HDMI ports but need five. This little box solved my problem. I plugged in a Playstation and an Amazon Fire TV box, the switch sees both and automatically switches back and forth between whatever is powered up. I still have one port to spare. It comes with a remote but I don't really see that I'll need to use it. The video quality seems perfect. I can't speak to it's longevity but at this price if it lasts a couple years I'll be glad to order another.
customer_reviews.author: Mark R.

customer_reviews.title: Okay, but has quirks.
customer_reviews.text: Switches inputs all the time even when only one device is on. My Nintendo switch and steam link cause the input to change all the time when doing updates/ checks online. I was hoping this device would fix the issue as my last one had the same problem, but no. Have to either wait a few seconds for it to change back or use the remote. Annoying when playing games or watching movies, as the devices that cause it to switch aren't actually turning on. The input doesn't always switch back by itself.
customer_reviews.author: J Baker

customer_reviews.title: So happy!
customer_reviews.text: I picked this up based on multiple recommendations from other websites to run multiple devices to our TV and I haven't had much luck in the past but this is amazing! Arrived on time, packing was amazing and the device was well protected from the carrier and weather. Super easy to set up and has worked well so far (2 use days), if there's an issue down the road this will be updated.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Rubeo

customer_reviews.title: It works great!
customer_reviews.text: First, it works great and is an attractive little box on top of my cabinet. Three small issues: 1. The IR sensor is a bit low and the front edge of the cabinet shadows the signal from the remote. I must pick up the remote and hold it high to select a different channel. 2. The LEDs are too bright. 3. The remote is too small. I struggled to print label that identified the 1-2-3 buttons.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Davis

customer_reviews.title: Excellent HDMI switch for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a different HDMI switch. This one operates very well and works as the description states. The automatic switching works fine. Active connections are indicated in a LED showing blue and connected but inactive connections are shown in the LED showing RED. Non-connected ports aren't illuminated at all. There's even an illuminated output LED. The illuminated LEDs are perfect for confirming there's a good connection between a device and the switch which was handy when I was connecting everything, not all HDMI switches give this indication. The remote is small but works well. Overall, I'm extremely pleased with this HDMI switch.
customer_reviews.author: Lloyd Black

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Great product, did everything that it was advertised to do; right out of the box. I tried three other devices prior to purchasing this product; none of them worked
customer_reviews.author: David T.

customer_reviews.title: Works with Nintendo Switch, PS3, and laptop
customer_reviews.text: It works exactly the way it's supposed to and switches automatically between a Nintendo Switch and a PS3. It can be finicky when I first connect my laptop (DisplayPort to HDMI) but I think that's because the laptop screen was off when I plugged in the HDMI cord. It works fine after I disconnect, get the display working on my laptop, and then plug it in. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: NattieJane

customer_reviews.title: Works great with Logitech Harmony Hub
customer_reviews.text: Works great with Logitech Harmony Hub, Dish DVR, Chromecast, AppleTV and Roku. DOES NOT WORK WELL WITH AMAZON FIRE. For some reason I get no image when trying to connect it to my Amazon Fire. I suspect this is a Fire issue as I've experienced similar issues with other switches and the Fire. So far this is the best switch I have ever used. Highly recommend for resolutions upto 1080p HD.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Very good for a modest price
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Kinivo 301BN I've bought and both work pretty much as advertised. I have an Xfinity X1 cable box, Sony Blue Ray player and Apple TV connected to a single HDMI Samsung TV, and the sigansl on all are clear. Sometimes the Kinivo doesn't recognize a source immediately,but a second click on the port number or sometimes repowering the source does the trick. For the price, this unit is a great way to connect multiple devices to one HDMI port.
customer_reviews.author: BSBAz

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for 2 years... but now...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product about 2.4 years ago and it was working fine until one port broke about a month ago. Now another port is not working. If I connect directly to my TV's HDMI port it works but through this device it doesn't. No Input siginal. I guess I am going to toss this one and get another one but not Kinivo.
customer_reviews.author: iBang

customer_reviews.title: Picture quality excellent but sound cuts in and out.  Does not auto switch between devices which is what I’d hoped for.
customer_reviews.text: I am using the switch to connect my cable box, DVD player and fire stick to my Samsung tv. Disappointed it will not auto switch when I power up a device like I was hoping. If I’m watching cable and power up dvd or fire stick it stays on cable port. Even when I power off cable box first. Worked great for about 3 days, now the sound goes out and comes back. Losing signal.. Tried other hdmi cables switching ports but sound drops. Works perfect when plugged directly into hdmi port on TV.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Does what I need it to and adds the convenience of a single display for multiple consoles
customer_reviews.text: The Kinivo 301BN is an excellent option for multiple consoles to a single display. The only quirk, which is no fault of the Kinivo I think, is that it completely changes my screen resolution and configuration on my Windows 7 laptop, which has multiple displays, when switching to an alternate console. Confusing, I know. The HDMI connections fit very snug into the ports. I actually didn't think they fit at first but with some forceful pushing they plugged in. Haven't had any issues running this for 10+ hours at a time. The remote works excellent, which is a nice touch. Overall, a great product that accomplishes exactly what I bought it for. 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Name

customer_reviews.title: IT WORKS!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried numerous hdmi switches to connect three devices to my single port TV and none of them worked. Sometimes no sound and sometimes sound with no picture. I attribute these issues to the fact that these switches relied solely on power supplied to the cables themselves and not to power supplied by the switch. This switch supplies power via ac adapter and solves this issue. It can handle up to 5 devices. It works as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Was great but useless now
customer_reviews.text: Have had for about 13 months and now the sound fails sometimes and it constantly tries to auto switch sources. Useless to me now! Update: Still useless, Either still auto switches source or shuts off source connection. Screen goes black, then comes back, then goes black over and over for up to 5 minutes at a time. Good luck playing a game on the PS4 online or watch a movie...Complete Garbage!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Orilio

customer_reviews.title: Have to unplug it when I turn TV on EVERY TIME!!
customer_reviews.text: The device allows you to change between different things (dvd, Nintendo Switch, and fire stick) seamlessly however it has to be unplugged before we turn our TV on EVERY time or the TV will not work?? I don’t understand it at all we have the work around which is just a big pain.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Leyshon

customer_reviews.title: Best picture quality
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing! Used to only need two hdmi ports to switch between. Then we needed 3 so I bought this little thing. It’s out in the open so I’m grateful it’s so attractive or else I would wanna hide it. The remote is amazing. Our last one didn’t have a remote and it totally beats getting up and switching manually. I also think this thing is probably the best quality because our picture is better than ever!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Owens

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine for 4 years, then started malfunctioning
customer_reviews.text: I have had this HDMI switch for roughly 4 years and it has started malfunctioning in the past 6 months. While streaming videos it will randomly switch to another channel, rapidly switch back to streaming, switch to white fuzz on the screen, then rinse & repeat sporadically for 30 seconds. I’ve tried unplugging everything, switching HDMI cables, switching ports & devices - nothing works. WOULD NOT RECOMMEND THIS PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.author: Product User

customer_reviews.title: This is garbage
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this for roughly 6 months. I’ve had issues with video dropping out with only Apple TV. This device indicated the OUTPUT was the issue by the blinking light on the output. After changing all of the HDMI cables I bypassed the Kinvo garbage and now I have NO PROBLEMS. This worked great at first but it didn’t last.
customer_reviews.author: Michael L Wooley

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this HDMI switch for a few months. Presently, I have a smaller space and multiple consoles. Since one of my screens is being used by two consoles, I wanted something to allow me to use my computer monitor for a third. This definitely helps with space issues and is easy/convenient to use. Setting it up is simple enough and it's fairly intuitive (switching when one device is turned on/off). I haven't had any issues with it so far. It is necessary to supply your own HDMI cables so make sure you have all that you need to connect your devices to the switch and the switch to your monitor/TV.
customer_reviews.author: JCTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Surprised!
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a simple go-to fix for my setup of multiple devices to a limited HDMI'd TV. The one I purchased was lacking that of 4K but back then it was needed. I'm really happy with it and I still have the older one till this day. I purchased a back up in 2015 just in case something goes wrong but it's pretty solid. Every now and then there are hiccups like lost of signal and I get a blue screen but all you have to do is hit the hdmi switch button and it refreshes. The control is lackluster and I barely even use it. The auto switch really helps.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: The be all and end all of HDMI hubs avaliable. Works flawlessly. 1080P. Automatically switches when a new input is activated. Reverts to the prior input when the most recent is deactivated. Comes with a cheesy little remote for manual switching. Never use it. No need. If you need a hub for multiple inputs (x5 or 3; depending on which model) this is the one to buy. If it craps out; I will update. - not for 4k televisions- 1080 only
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't stop switching
customer_reviews.text: I had the 3-port version, worked great. 5 Stars. This 5-port product is awful. It worked for 1 hour with a PS4, Xbox, Comcast and Nintendo Classic connected. It constantly switches when we start up the PS4. It Goes back and forth between comcast and PS4 without us touching anything. It only works if we disconnect all other HDMI cords. Useless product, very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: PC Guru

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable or user friendly in my setting
customer_reviews.text: It works – sort of – but it's very fussy in my not-rare setting: a crappy cable company with a sometimes weak signal. If anyone jiggles any cord in my setup, boom! The picture or sound or both are out. I then have to check all the connections and reboot everything, and maybe it works for a few days – until someone else bumps something. At least I'm getting good at the setup process, which is not terribly user friendly – when to hook up what connection, and if it's supposed to be powered up when you do. I'm returning it if I can after fussing with it for a month.
customer_reviews.author: M. Herbst
